title: Create useEmailLinkAuth Hook
body:
## ğŸ¯ Objective

Create a custom React hook to handle Firebase email link authentication logic.

## ğŸ“‹ Implementation Details

- Send email link functionality
- Complete email link sign-in
- Error handling for Firebase auth errors
- Loading states
- Local storage management for cross-device support

### File Location
`src/hooks/useEmailLinkAuth.ts`

### Hook Interface
```typescript
export function useEmailLinkAuth() {
  const sendEmailLink: (email: string) => Promise<{success: boolean, error?: string}>;
  const completeEmailLinkSignIn: (emailLink: string) => Promise<{success: boolean, user?: FirebaseUser, error?: string}>;
  const isLoading: boolean;
  const error: string | null;
}
```

### Key Features
- Firebase `sendSignInLinkToEmail` integration
- Firebase `signInWithEmailLink` integration
- ActionCodeSettings configuration
- Cross-device email storage in localStorage
- Comprehensive error handling
- iOS/Android deep linking support

title: Implement Rate Limiting for Email Link Requests
body:
## ğŸ¯ Objective

Implement client-side rate limiting to prevent abuse of email link sending functionality.

## ğŸ“‹ Implementation Details

### Rate Limiting Requirements
- Maximum 3 email requests per 5-minute window
- Client-side enforcement using localStorage
- Clear user feedback when rate limited
- Countdown timer showing when next request allowed

### Implementation Approach
- Create custom hook `useRateLimiter`
- Track request timestamps in localStorage
- Integrate with EmailLinkInputForm component
- Display rate limit messaging

### File Locations
- `src/hooks/useRateLimiter.ts` (new)
- Update `src/components/auth/EmailLinkInputForm.tsx`

### Rate Limiter Hook
```typescript
const useRateLimiter = (maxAttempts: number = 3, windowMs: number = 300000) => {
  const canMakeRequest: () => boolean;
  const recordAttempt: () => void;
  const timeUntilNextAttempt: () => number;
}
```

## ğŸ§ª Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Rate limiting works (3 requests per 5 minutes)
- [ ] User receives clear feedback when rate limited
- [ ] Countdown timer shows time until next allowed request
- [ ] Rate limiting persists across browser sessions
- [ ] Rate limiting resets after time window
- [ ] Error messages are user-friendly
- [ ] Rate limiting doesn't interfere with successful requests

## ğŸ“š Reference

See `FIREBASE_PASSWORDLESS_AUTH_DESIGN.md` lines 632-656 for implementation details.

}
